p: Various methods of use of the medicinal plants’ parts were reported; about 19% of the plants used by the informants were consumed directly as raw material. However, most often, a decoction was prepared (27%) which involved boiling the crushed plant part in water till the volume will be reduced by around the half to extract the juice to be administered orally. Moreover, 18% of the reported plant parts were crushed or powdered while 16% were used as infusion. Herbal infusions take less time to prepare than decoction, but the herbs should stand for 10 min in hot water to steep thoroughly while tightly covered. In other cases, plant part was dried then administered orally as pills. Besides, seeds, if not administered orally, were used for oil extraction ( Fig. 4).
